components.description: Two hands clapping emoji, which when used multiple times can be used as a round of applause.
components.title: Clapping Hands Sign

description: Two hands clapping emoji, which when used multiple times can be used as a round of applause.
title: Clapping Hands Sign

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Hand symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: Two hands clapping emoji, which when used multiple times can be used¬†as a round of applause. Clapping Hands was approved as part of Unicode  http://emojipedia.org/clapping-hands-sign/
emoji_net_data.name: clapping hands

bn:00100266a: Expressive of sympathetic pleasure or joy on account of someone's success or good fortune

bn:00082212v: Clap one's hands or shout after performances to indicate approval
To praise or show approval, by clapping the hands.
To express approval (of something) by clapping the hands.
To shout approval; to express great approval.

bn:00093846v: To cause something to strike soundly.
To strike on the cheek with the open hand.
Hit with something flat, like a paddle or the open hand

bn:00005053n: The act of applauding; approbation and praise publicly expressed by the clapping of hands, stamping or tapping of the feet, acclamation, huzzas, or other means; marked commendation.
A demonstration of approval by clapping the hands together
A clap is the percussive sound made by striking together two flat surfaces, as in the body parts of humans or animals.
Praise or approval, expressed by clapping the hands.
Applause is primarily the expression of approval by the act of clapping, or striking the palms of the hands together, in order to create noise.

bn:01193643n: The act of expressing approval or admiration; commendation; laudation.
Praise is the act of making positive statements about a person, object or idea, either in public or privately.

bn:00042759n: That part of the fore limb below the forearm or wrist in primates (including humans).
The part of the fore limb below the forearm or wrist in a human, and the corresponding part in many other animals.
The zoological term for the distal portion of the forelimb of an animal (including the human hand)
The (prehensile) extremity of the superior limb
The manus is the zoological term for the distal portion of the fore limb of an animal.
A hand, as the part of the fore limb below the forearm in a man, or the corresponding part in other vertebrates.
A hand is a prehensile, multi-fingered extremity located at the end of an arm or forelimb of primates such as humans, chimpanzees, monkeys, and lemurs.

bn:00021834n: An expression of approval and commendation
Expressing praise and approval, expressing approbation.
An expression of approval and commendation.
